channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Probing weak chemical interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated AFM tips identifies molecular adsorption sites
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 23 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63159-x

Understanding molecule-surface interactions is key to neat on-surface synthesis of functional nanomaterials. Here, the authors measure interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated tips to reveal their nature and reliable adsorption sites.
item.dc:title: Probing weak chemical interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated AFM tips identifies molecular adsorption sites
item.dc:creator: Jalmar Tschakert
Qigang Zhong
Alexander Sekels
Pascal Henkel
Jannis Jung
K. Linus H. Pohl
Hermann A. Wegner
Doreen Mollenhauer
André Schirmeisen
Daniel Ebeling
